title: (x) Juillet - Labomatik {Bender}
content:
hi typophiles, can someone id this font?   
thx, romesh   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142154im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24260.jpg)
author: nike

comments.content:
It's so familiar...   
   
I just can't remember where I saw it.

hi people, this one has been designed by pascal bejean, whom i'm worknig with at the labomatic studio (labomatic.org), you can buy it directly here [http://typotek.free.fr/caracteres/labomatic.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142154/http:/typotek.free.fr/caracteres/labomatic.html)   
you can send me a mail, i'll give you his mail.

merci yves, je lui dirai de vive voix !   
i'll tell him (for those who don't speak french)
thanks alot, bender. this is really a beautiful typeface.
isn�t this font availble to PC?
(and why french!);) I can�t even order the font because of my lack of french...

I can't help you with the French part, although I'm sure some here can do that too. As for the Mac-only format, it might be time for you to look into font conversion tools. I know FontLab has [TransType](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142154/http:/www.fontlab.com/html/transtype.html), and I believe there are other tools around, possibly even shareware/freeware. (I use Fontographer to convert PC to Mac when needed, but that's a different investment.)

By the way, I happened across a similar-looking font yesterday in the Indie Fonts 2 book: [Identikal's Angol](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142154/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=265). It doesn't have the mix of angular & normal letters that Labomatik has, or the ink-trap design detail (as far as I can see in the samples), but it is quite similar in concept, to my eyes.

Go to [http://www.labomatic.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142154/http:/www.labomatic.org/), in contact you'll find the pascal's mail. He speaks a better english that mine and will be glad to respond to your answer.
